intro: Pergularia daemia subsp. barbata, commonly known as the hairy pogostemon, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky outcrops. Its flowers are often pink or purple and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is a perennial species that can form dense mats, contributing to soil stabilization in its native habitat.
